Name: Santo Domingo
Description: The capital region and largest city in the Dominican Republic, known for its rich history, colonial architecture, and vibrant cultural scene.

Name: Puerto Plata
Description: A coastal region known for its stunning beaches, historical attractions, and popular resort areas.

Name: La Vega
Description: Famous for its mountainous terrain and annual carnival, La Vega is also known for its agricultural industry.

Name: Santiago
Description: The second-largest city in the country, known for its industrial growth and cultural significance as the heart of the Cibao region.

Name: San Cristóbal
Description: A region known for its agricultural products and historical landmarks, including the famous San Cristóbal Castle.

Name: San Juan
Description: A rural region, known for its tobacco production, and is considered one of the country’s breadbaskets.

Name: Montecristi
Description: A coastal province known for its beaches, natural beauty, and the popular Morro de Montecristi.

Name: Barahona
Description: A region known for its breathtaking beaches, rivers, and diverse ecosystems, often referred to as the soul of the Caribbean.
